text:
I grew up in a small, rural town in the Midwest. My childhood was filled with sunshine and laughter, and I have fond memories of the people and places that shaped my early years. 

My parents were both hard-working and loving, and my brother and I had a great relationship. We spent our days playing outside and exploring the woods and fields around our home. We would often go fishing and swimming in the nearby lake, and we loved chasing each other around in the summer heat. 

I went to a small school in town, and most of my friends were people I had known since I was young. We would often go on bike rides and play in the park, and I also enjoyed helping my father with his work at the local farm. I remember the thrill of helping him with the harvest, and the joy of bringing in a successful crop.

I was an imaginative child who loved to read and write. I was particularly fond of books about fairies and the natural world, and I loved dreaming of far-off places. I was often found daydreaming in the garden, or wandering off into the woods to explore. 

I was also an adventurous child, and I enjoyed taking risks and pushing my boundaries. I remember the first time I climbed a tall tree, and the feeling of pride and accomplishment I felt when I reached the top. As I grew older, I took up horse riding and enjoyed exploring the countryside on horseback.

I was also a kind and generous child, and I remember being particularly fond of animals. I often took in stray cats and dogs, and I loved spending time with them and caring for them. I was also passionate about the environment and enjoyed learning about the flora and fauna of my local area. 

My childhood was filled with happy memories and I will always cherish them. I was fortunate to grow up in a beautiful and safe environment, surrounded by people who loved and supported me. I am grateful for the experiences and memories that shaped my early years, and that still remain with me today.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, agreeable, unconscientious, emotionally stable, and open to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(b) Notices other people’s weak points

(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)

(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
